songwriting production i would argue he

18 tracks of what i felt were some of

wonderful project highly recommended if

has served as
a name and a place for rory to
create and experiment without borders or
expectations
his releases as scallops hotel in my
assessment historically
have had a lot less conceptual and
structural ambition
than even some of his most out there
milo records
but i do think bob's son here does try
to find compromise between
rory's creative left and right brains
while
also serving as a tribute to the late

abominism with the closing track on this
thing mostly being a

for the rest of this thing again i think

trying to keep it unpredictable while

and also making clearer illusions and

i don't know a beat poetry or slam
